intro: Zannichellia tuberosa, commonly known as the tuberous water-starwort, is a aquatic plant belonging to the family Hydrocharitaceae. It is characterized by its submerged, branching stems and small, green, ovate leaves that are often arranged in whorls. The plant produces tiny, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or brown, which develop into small, round fruits containing numerous seeds. Zannichellia tuberosa is native to Europe and parts of Asia, and it thrives in still or slow-moving freshwater environments. Its tuberous roots help it survive in muddy substrates and contribute to its ecological role in aquatic ecosystems.
